Build ID: M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Right click on Mylar Task List, Select "New Repository Task ..."
2.In the "New Repository Task" dialog select "Add Task Repository"

What is your Mylar configuration, i.e. what connectors do you have installed?  I assume now.

The current work-around for this is to install a single connector (e.g. Bugzilla, for connecting to bugs.eclipse.org).  Without a connector there are no repositories to add so I'm marking this as minor, but we will have it fixed for next Friday's 1.0.1.

(In reply to comment #1)
> The current work-around for this is to install a single connector (e.g.
> Bugzilla, for connecting to bugs.eclipse.org).  Without a connector there are
> no repositories to add so I'm marking this as minor

That's not true. I came upon this issue when I tried to add a Mantis repository buy using the web connector. I didn't have other connectors installed, but it's worth nothing the web connector is not offered as a separate feature.
Anyway, the workaround worked for me.
Yes, the web connector is not a separate connector, and that's what I (imprecisely) meant by "install a connector".  The bug was that you needed more than one, and the web one is always there.
